messages: 16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:13): I'm using the HTML5 boilerplate build script. it says you should use a style.css, which imports the needed CSS files. this is fine is most cases, but I have a custom page that needs an entirely different layout. how may I do this?
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:14): just include a new css file if you want?
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:14): if you want a single css file output at the end of the build then you need to @import
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:14): otherwise include as you feel like

16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:15): in my default.properties I have file.root.stylesheet = style.css. the build.xml looks for this. when it finds it, it gets concatenated with the @imports it holds, minified and renamed to its sha value. however, my style.css imports my _global_ layout. however, I have a page with a completely other design
16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:16): and this design should use completely other CSS files, which I want to be concatenated and minified as well

16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:17): so problem is, if I include style.css in this custom design, all my global CSS files will be included, because file.root.stylesheet can only equal style.css. if it's called anything else it won't be processed
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:19): 16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122: can you file a ticket at https://github.com/paulirish/html5-boilerplate/issues/
16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:19): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: yes. so this isn't possible?
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:19): no i dont think so.
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:19): we recommend using a single stylesheet
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:20): yeah the buildscript doesnt fare too well if you use different sheets for diff pages
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:20): its not that smart

16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:21): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: but that means I would have to include ALL the CSS declarations across ALL my pages (that is, support the CSS for about 200 pages in one page)
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:21): how big is one of those extra files
16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:22): I have ~200 different CSS files ranging from 10-200 lines
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:22): 16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122: even if you ahve radically different layout you shouldnt have too much code
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:23): the network cost of an extra HTTP request is really high

16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:23): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: well, it's not really a solution for me to package all my CSS in one file. sure, you have to minimize the HTTP requests but each page is unique
16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:23): but anyway, problem is, I have a page that's completely different. so they would conflict
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:24): then maybe you should run the build script on each page?
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:24): 16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122: you could customize the build script for your reqiurement in project.xml
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:24): because this is not a typical requirement
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:24): for most websites.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:25): we're interested in the solution when you figure it out

16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:25): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: so to be clear, most websites package all their CSS across all pages in one file? (of course, you can split it in the imports for maintainability)
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:26): its what is recommended choice.
16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:26): I just fear that this CSS file will be way too large at some point as your site increases in size. however, that's not a problem?
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (18:26): if you gzip your files it wont be that large.

16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122 (18:30): a solution would be to allow the user to define some default stylesheets and define page-specific stylesheets that can be concatenated and minified as well. then the user wouldn't have to download the default stylesheets all the time but download the page-specific ones. most users don't see all pages anyway
175e7f457c8f4893c459a9e6d57d0f76 (18:54): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, I've seen a lot of sites use a server-side language to compile different css files and return them to the user as one.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:55): 16a9b5ff504eb5cb01b1971987a97122: i think if you put a stylesheet ref outside of the comments
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:55): maybe need to add it to the bypass as well? ?
513dbf85640888dca3d9aa6998647cfc (19:01): is there a way to get an array with all images embedded in a canvas?
1353d9b683d6d7b4281d762ca742bdb9 (19:05): 513dbf85640888dca3d9aa6998647cfc, images aren't embedded into a canvas, they're just painted.  its  raster, it doesn't maintain a list of objects
1353d9b683d6d7b4281d762ca742bdb9 (19:05): you'll have to use svg for that or maintain the list yourself
513dbf85640888dca3d9aa6998647cfc (19:05): hmmm right, okay :)
